summary: Frontend testing of the Unterrichtsreihe to Arbeitsplan transfer fix completed successfully. The fix in CurriculumPlannerPage.js correctly uses the class schedule to place entries in the correct periods instead of hardcoding period 1.
passed_tests: Selecting 6a - Deutsch class in modal dropdown
Success toast displayed: 'Unterrichtsreihe wurde in den Arbeitsplan übernommen'
Console log shows correct schedule: {monday: [2,3], wednesday: [3], thursday: [4], friday: [2]}
Database entries created with correct periods (verified via API)
Entries displayed in correct cells according to schedule
critical_code_review_comments: The getScheduledSlots function in CurriculumPlannerPage.js correctly iterates through days and collects periods from the class schedule
The handleSubmit function properly uses scheduledSlots to create entries with correct date and period values
Console logging is helpful for debugging (lines 153-155)

success_rate.frontend: 100% (all transfer and display features working correctly)

seed_data_creation: Created 6 workplan entries for 6a-Deutsch class starting from 2026-04-06 with correct periods
context_for_next_testing_agent: The fix for transferring Unterrichtsreihen to Arbeitsplan is WORKING CORRECTLY. The getScheduledSlots function in CurriculumPlannerPage.js now correctly uses the class schedule to determine which periods to use for each day. Verified that entries for 6a-Deutsch (schedule: monday [2,3], wednesday [3], thursday [4], friday [2]) are created with the correct periods and displayed in the correct cells in the Arbeitsplan table. Old entries with period 1 still exist in the database from before the fix was applied.
